archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Jerk Habanero Chicken Wings with Grilled Corn–Avocado Salad
description: Firey jerk-style habanero wings grilled hot and served with a bright Mexican-inspired corn–avocado salad. Built fast for a family heat night.
prep_steps: Pat dry chicken wings with paper towel.
In a small bowl, mix salt, black pepper, allspice, and ground cumin.
Halve the lime; zest one half and juice both halves into separate small bowls.
Shuck corn if needed. Cut avocado into medium dice. Finely chop red onion, jalapenos, and coriander.
In a small saucepan, combine habanero sauce with 1 tablespoon lime juice and honey; set aside for stovetop warming.
cook_steps: Toss chicken wings with olive oil, then coat evenly with the spice mix.
Place corn on the hot grill; cook 8–10 minutes, turning until lightly charred. Set aside to cool.
Grill wings 14–18 minutes total, turning every 4–5 minutes until cooked through and crispy at the edges.
While wings grill, warm the habanero sauce mixture over StoveTop on low for 2–3 minutes until slightly thickened; remove from heat.
Cut kernels off the grilled corn. In a bowl, combine corn, avocado, red onion, jalapenos, coriander, lime zest, remaining lime juice, a drizzle of olive oil, and a pinch of salt; toss gently.
Brush grilled wings with the warm habanero glaze on both sides and grill 1 more minute per side to set.
Serve wings hot with the corn–avocado salad on the side.

ingredients.preparation: for wings, plus 1 teaspoon for salad
for wings, plus pinch for salad
